message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of codes providing authentication and secrecy, which are topics typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT), cryptography (cs.CR), and coding theory (cs.CC) sub-categories. The combinatorial nature of the constructions suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the discrete mathematics (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on equiprobable source probability distributions may make it relevant to the statistical learning (cs.SI) sub-category.
